_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:26:10 using v2.0
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of patients delayed?
analysis_commentary: A decrease in the number of patients delayed over time can be seen when either NHS, or social care organisations, or both, are responsible for the delay. However, delays due to social care have fallen the most, a 45% decrease in the number of patients experiencing a delay in discharge between August 2010 (1,723 patients) and December 2013 (941 patients). This is compared to a 16% decrease attributable to NHS organisations.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
